headline: Ohio Gov. DeWine bans purchases of Russian goods, services
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: The Ohio Division of Liquor Control (DOLC), a division of the Ohio Department of Commerce, estimates that there are approximately 6,400 bottles of vodka made by Russian Standard currently for sale in Ohio's 487 liquor agencies across the state.

"Ohioans stand with the people of Ukraine and all of the freedom-loving people of the world against this unprovoked and unconscionable invasion that has led to so much suffering and destruction," DeWine said.
The announcement comes days after the governor directed the Ohio Department of Commerce to cease both the purchase and sale of all vodka made by Russian Standard until further notice.

Related video above: Cincinnatians fear rising gas prices will worsen amid Russian invasion
"We will not support Russia with Ohio taxpayer dollars," DeWine said.
The governor issued a statement Wednesday, saying the state has no current contracts with Russian businesses and now the state will not have any going forward.
The governor also called on the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation and state pension funds' efforts to get rid of any Russian assets as soon as possible.
All other brands of vodka that are sold in Ohio, including those branded with Russian names are purchased from distilleries not located in Russia.
The DOLC has directed these retailers to immediately pull Green Mark Vodka and Russian Standard Vodka from their shelves.
Mike DeWine is banning the purchases of Russian goods and services as the country continues its invasion of Ukraine.
Russian Standard's vodka is sold under the brand names of Green Mark Vodka and Russian Standard Vodka.
